0.title: Punjab CM Channi, Sidhu Moose Wala booked for violating poll code
0.article_body: Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi and Congress candidate Sidhu Moose Wala were booked for violating the model code of conduct. This comes following a complaint by Aam Aadmi Party alleging that Channi and Sidhu held a door-to-door campaign in Mansa beyond the 6 pm deadline on Friday. A case under Section 188 of IPC was filed against Channi and Sidhu.

1.title: Man finds chicken foot in takeaway meal in UK; shares pic
1.article_body: A man has said he was left feeling "physically sick" after finding a deep-fried chicken foot in his takeaway meal. The man who ordered a salt and pepper chicken dish shared a picture of the chicken foot. The customer said he contacted the takeaway and claims they hung up the phone on him after he complained.

2.title: Conditions are ideal for more dangerous COVID-19 variants to emerge: WHO
2.article_body: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has said conditions are ideal for "more transmissible, more dangerous COVID-19 variants to emerge". "But we can end the pandemic as a global health emergency this year," he added. The lower severity of the Omicron variant combined with high vaccine coverage in some countries is "driving a dangerous narrative that COVID-19 is over", he warned.

3.title: Kejriwal inaugurates 12,430 new smart classrooms in 240 Delhi govt schools
3.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday inaugurated 12,430 new smart classrooms in 240 government schools in the city. Delhi Deputy CM and Education Minister Manish Sisodia, and Delhi Home Minister Satyendar Jain were also present at the event held at a school in Rajokri. "These world-class classrooms have...modern techno-features...[are] disabled-friendly," Delhi's Directorate of Education said.

4.title: Zuckerberg's sister Randi releases crypto-themed version of Adele's 'Hello'
4.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's sister Randi Zuckerberg has released a parody video of Adele's song 'Hello', featuring lyrics about cryptocurrencies and decentralised finance (DeFi). "Community should be fun, crypto should be welcoming not intimidating," she tweeted. Randi is the Founder of Hug, a platform that supports Web3 creators, and a member of crypto exchange Okcoin's advisory council.

5.title: Congress leader uses donkey to protest against T'gana CM; arrested for stealing it
5.article_body: Telangana Congress leader Venkat Balmoor was arrested on charges of stealing a donkey after he led a protest with the donkey on Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao's birthday. He and others had placed up a picture of the CM on the donkey. They were protesting against the CM for "making false promises of jobs and not issuing government employment notifications".

6.title: CBI arrests AAP's Delhi municipal councillor over bribery charges
6.article_body: CBI on Friday arrested Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) East Delhi Municipal Corporation councillor Geeta Rawat, along with another accused over bribery charges. Rawat had allegedly demanded a bribe of ₹20,000 from the complainant for her favour to lay the roof of his building. "There's corruption in every corner in the AAP government," West Delhi MP Parvesh Sahib Singh said.

7.title: Student told to remove 'tilak' from forehead to enter Karnataka college
7.article_body: Amid the ongoing hijab row, a student was stopped from entering the premises of a college in the Indi town of Karnataka's Vijayapura district for sporting a 'tilak' (vermilion) on his forehead, as per reports. The college authorities reportedly stopped the student at the gate and asked him to remove the 'tilak' from his forehead before entering the college.

8.title: PM pushes for early completion of 508-km Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project
8.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has pushed for the early completion of the 508-kilometre-long Mumbai-Ahmedabad high-speed rail project. The PM said his government's focus is on creating infrastructure for the 21st century in the financial capital. The bullet train project is need of the hour to strengthen the infrastructure capacity building and reinforce Mumbai's identity as the "city of dreams", he added.

9.title: Aishwarya in talks to star opposite Rajinikanth in Nelson's next: Report
9.article_body: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan is reportedly in talks to join Rajinikanth in Nelson Dilipkumar's next film, tentatively titled 'Thalaivar 169'. The actors previously worked together in 2010 film 'Enthiran' aka 'Robot', which was directed by Shankar. The upcoming project will reportedly go on the floors this year. "It's a typical Nelson Dilipkumar film that's high on content," a source told Pinkvilla.

10.title: Reality hit me hard when I saw Bappi da's body, I broke down: Shaan
10.article_body: Singer Shaan has said he was shattered when he saw late musician Bappi Lahiri for the last time. "The reality hit me when I...saw his body...It really caught me and I broke down," he added. "His daughter (Rema) was inconsolable...She kept saying to Bappi da, 'Look, Shaan is here...say hi to him.' It was an emotionally heavy moment," said Shaan.

11.title: Pune district records below 1,000 daily COVID-19 cases for 7 days
11.article_body: Pune district has recorded less than 1,000 daily coronavirus cases for seven days in a row with 576 new cases on Friday, according to official data. The district also reported three deaths the same day and currently has 6,032 active cases. The Pune Municipal Corporation recorded the highest new cases at 322, taking its progressive count to 6,76,639.

12.title: Delhi University starts COVID vaccination drive for students & staff
12.article_body: Delhi University has begun its COVID-19 vaccination drive for students, teaching and non-teaching staff at WUS Health Centre at North Campus and in West Delhi, an official said. While the vaccination centre in West Delhi will run from Monday to Saturday, candidates can get vaccinated in the North campus on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday from 10 am to 4 pm.

13.title: Dhoni is the best captain of all time, Yuvraj is my idol: Tewatia
13.article_body: Responding to a query about the cricketer he considers the "best captain" of all time, all-rounder Rahul Tewatia named MS Dhoni adding that Yuvraj Singh is his "idol". Tewatia was bought by franchise Gujarat Titans for ₹9 crore in the IPL mega auction and termed Rashid Khan as the player who could be the team's MVP in IPL 2022.

14.title: Great character on display: Virat Kohli on India winning 2nd T20I vs WI
14.article_body: Reacting to India's triumph by eight runs in the second T20I against West Indies to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series, Virat Kohli said there was "great character" on display. "Went down to the wire," added Kohli on the match which saw West Indies compete till the last over having been handed a target of 187 runs.

15.title: 100 modified bike silencers seized in Mumbai for noise pollution
15.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police seized about 100 bikes using modified silencers which were creating loud noise on the roads. ''Most of the bikes seized were of Royal Enfield or Pulsar. These bikes were returned only after the bike owners brought the original silencer and installed it,'' DCP Traffic said. We crushed the modified silencers using a bulldozer, he added.

16.title: Villagers lynch realtor mistaking him for cattle thief in WB
16.article_body: A 35-year-old real estate agent from Kolkata was lynched by locals of Baruipur in West Bengal after they allegedly mistook him for a cattle thief on Friday. According to police, he was tied to a lamp post and thrashed by the villagers. "We are...trying to find out whether the lynching is related to a business rivalry," police said.

17.title: Customs detects drugs worth ₹9.82 crore at B'luru airport; 2 held
17.article_body: Bengaluru Customs tweeted on Friday that its Central Intelligence Unit has detected about 1 kg of heroin and 4.58 kg of MDMA/Ecstasy pills worth a total of ₹9.82 crore in two courier parcels at the Kempegowda International Airport. The two courier parcels were each from Belgium and Zambia, it said. Two persons have been arrested so far, it added.

18.title: Nandi hills ropeway project gets approval from K'taka government
18.article_body: The ropeway project at Nandi hills worth ₹93.40 crore was approved by the Karnataka state government under a public-private-participation (PPP) model on Friday. With 18 towers, the ropeway project will be 2.93-km long. It will take around 28 minutes to complete a round trip. The cabinet has given a nod for 50 cabins accommodating 10 passengers each for the ropeway.

19.title: UPSC increases civil services vacancies; cross 1000-mark after 6 years
19.article_body: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has modified the number of civil services vacancies for this year, increasing the number from 861 to 1,011. It's after six years that UPSC has crossed the 1,000-mark in its vacancies. The increase comes after the government decided to recruit 150 personnel in IRMS Group 'A' through the Civil Services Examination 2022.

20.title: Gold worth over ₹21 lakh seized from aircraft at Trichy airport
20.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit seized 421 grams of gold worth ₹21.50 lakh from a flight at Tiruchirappalli airport. An abandoned packet was found concealed inside the panel beneath a seat of the aircraft inbound from Dubai, a senior customs official said on Friday. "On extraction, gold ingot of 24 karat purity weighing 421 grams...was recovered," the official added.

21.title: Six-lane Bahadurpura Flyover to be ready by March 31: GHMC
21.article_body: The Bahadurpura Flyover will be available for commuters by March 31, 2022, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation informed while sharing pictures on Twitter. The six-lane bi-directional flyover, part of the Strategic Road Development Program (SRDP), is being built at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore. It will reduce pollution and benefit people visiting the Nehru Zoological park, the GHMC added.

22.title: 18-yr-old Raj girl kills self over not getting new phone on b'day
22.article_body: An 18-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide over not getting a new mobile phone for her birthday in Jaipur's Rajasthan on Friday. A senior police official said that the deceased's father had assured her that she will get a phone after her Class 12 boards. The girl had demanded a new phone for playing PUBG, the senior police official added.

23.title: TV producer killed trying to prevent street robbery in Pakistan
23.article_body: A TV producer was shot and killed in Pakistan's Karachi while trying to prevent a street robbery on Friday, police said. Athar Mateen, who was heading home after dropping his children at school, saw two bike-borne men snatching something from a passerby. Mateen then allegedly rammed his car into their motorcycle, but one of the accused opened fire at him.

24.title: Baseless: Russia after US accuses it of cyberattacks on Ukraine
24.article_body: Russia has rejected "baseless" US allegations that it was responsible for cyberattacks on Ukrainian defence agencies and major banks. The US had accused the Russian special services of Tuesday's cyberattacks. "Russia has nothing to do with the mentioned events and in principle has never conducted and doesn't conduct any 'malicious' operations in cyberspace," the Russian Embassy in the US said.

25.title: Punjab CM Channi, Sidhu Moose Wala booked for violating poll code
25.article_body: Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi and Congress candidate Sidhu Moose Wala were booked for violating the model code of conduct. This comes following a complaint by Aam Aadmi Party alleging that Channi and Sidhu held a door-to-door campaign in Mansa beyond the 6 pm deadline on Friday. A case under Section 188 of IPC was filed against Channi and Sidhu.
